intro: Astragalus glaucopsiformis, commonly known as the bluish-form leaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, bluish-green leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access moisture from lower soil layers. Astragalus glaucopsiformis is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
